abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcome is adjudged satisfactory
            with project sustainability highly likely. All activities
            were implemented as anticipated with minor modifications
            described in the report. Both World Bank and Borrower
            performances are rated satisfactory overall. Several lessons
            were culled from this project, notably, the Bank should
            ensure consistency between government goals and project
            objectives and between project objectives and project
            components; ensure development ad adoption of specific
            project monitoring indicators and obtain consensus on them
            by the stakeholders; and analyze the legal and regulatory
            environment as well as the institutional capacity related to
            reform in order to identify needed changes; identify and
            resolve key reform prerequisites during negotiation stage;
            and ensure that supervision visits are frequent and that
            there is continuity in choosing consultants. On the other
            hand, major lessons for the Borrower are to involve all the
            pertinent stakeholders to ensure ownership and project
            implementation; design a communications strategy targeted to
            different audience groups; devise in advance alternative
            scenarios for implementing reform to make reform adapt to
            any changes; ensure that institutional reform include
            organizational change; select the appropriate personnel to
            manage the project; develop comprehensive training; and
            develop feedback channels.
